alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Lamar; Marion; Walker; Winston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 5:34AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Walker, southern Marion, southern Winston, Fayette and Lamar Counties through 630 AM CDT... At 533 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Helicon to near Detroit. Movement was south at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Jasper, Hamilton, Winfield, Fayette, Sumiton, Cordova, Dora, Carbon Hill, Vernon, Sulligent, Millport, Lynn, Arley, Guin, Berry, Double Springs, Parrish, Brilliant, Oakman and Glen Allen. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
